results.title: Jelly-like, worm-like and colonial invertebrates
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
This film covers various invertebrates living on the shores of British Columbia. Included are jellyfish, anemones, worms and the colonial bryozoans.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Molluscs
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
The marine fauna of the British Columbian coast is extremely diverse. The more common animals of the phylum molluscs from the classes Amphineura, Gastropoda, Pelecypoda, Cephalopoda are illustrated. Shows their size, habitat and feeding habits. Industrialisation and pollution have led to the destruction of many molluscs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Duellists [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, David Puttnam and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: In the early nineteenth century two officers in Napoleon’s army challenge each other to a duel. Their initial skirmish, which begins over a trivial insult, becomes a fierce and obsessive passion which dominates the lives of the men over thirty years. This beautifully photographed film is a penetrating study of the lunacy of war and the decay of the aristocratic class in Europe. The first feature by Ridley Scott, its ravishing imagery recalls the classicism of pictorial art of the period: the characters are framed in backgrounds that suggest Constable and Watteau. As the two men’s bitter feud enters its second decade, the images owe much to Turner and Delacroix. The rigid codes of pre-Napoleanic France are swept away by the romantic tide of revolution. With Harvey Keitel, Keith Carradine, Albert Finney and Tom Conti. Winner of Best Debut Film, Cannes, 1977. Based on Joseph Conrad’s short story. Also available on VHS [304321]

results.title: The Disco years
results.creator_credit: Robert Lee King, Richard Hoffman, John Peter James and RLK Productions
results.brief_description: Tom is in his final year of High School, desperately fighting against his attraction for the athletic Matt. In the overtly homophobic environment of school there is no-one Tom can talk to about his sexuality. Except, maybe, for the new teacher Mr. Reece? This bittersweet short film is a very funny and very poignant story about coming out as gay in the late seventies, in the disco years, where liberation began on the dancefloor. With Matt Nolan and Dennis Christopher.

results.title: The Ebony tower
results.creator_credit: John Fowles, Robert Knights, Roy Roberts and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description: An aging artist (Laurence Olivier) and his two young companions, “The Mouse” (Greta Scacchi) and “The Freak” (Toyah Willcox) find their idyllic life suddenly interrupted by the visit of a young art critic (Roger Rees). Based on the book by John Fowles with screenplay by John Mortimer.

results.title: The Director and the film: David Lean
results.creator_credit: Hazel Wilkinson and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: David Lean in a discussion with actress Maureen Pryor, comments on the aims and techniques he used in ‘The Sound Barrier’, ‘Brief Encounter’, ‘Bridge on the River Kwai’ and ‘Summer Madness’. (nb: A black and white film except for the extract from ‘Summer madness’ which is colour)

results.title: The Earth beneath me
results.brief_description: Follow Dick Smith as he travels solo around the world in his Bell Jetranger across some of the most inhospitable and lonely places in the world; the Arctic Circle; the deserts of Africa; the jungles of South East Asia. He also flies over some the world most famous landmarks; the Leaning Tower of Pisa, the Parthenon, Pyramids, Mount Everest, Taj Mahal and Australia’s own, Sydney Opera House. No other production details available. Warning; there are tracking problems at the start of the video and the image drops out during the end credits.

results.title: The Director [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Patrick Hughes and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: An ex crew member in witness protection recalls what it was like to work for “Jack” - the eponymous director of the title. The finely tuned professional outfit that is “the crew”, arrive at the Western Bank for a shoot, centred around the director, a man who wields awesome power and will do anything for the sake of realism and reaping the benefits at the box office.

results.title: Amelia Rose Towers
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Ashley Scarlett, Nicole Sorby and Jackie Farkas
results.brief_description: If, as a child, you were picked last for a team and sought as your refuge a wish or a dream. If you ever felt lonely, peculiar or blue, then Amelia Rose Towers is a bit like you! True! Amelia Rose Towers, ‘whose initials spell ART’, faces off against an adversary whose initials spell MAN, after passing through surrealist chambers and screens offering images of a personal identity that can never be reconciled. A story of juggling variables of reality of self and other; of space, time and perceptions; of the art of science and the science of art but it is also a story of hope, love and courage.
